subs.text: @mattfcoop So far, no. However, the speakers are not very loud. I wonder if a software update reduced the power output.

subs.text: @RyanLounsbury Very much so. The 12th gen Intel chips are architected with multiple performance and efficiency cores. There‚Äôs far less difference between a Core i3 and i5 from what I can see and based on reviewing the designs.
subs.rawText: @RyanLounsbury Very much so. The 12th gen Intel chips are architected with multiple performance and efficiency cores. There‚Äôs far less difference between a Core i3 and i5 from what I can see and based on reviewing the designs.

subs.text: @ashishmohta @ThatBlairGuy Teslas and other EVs do the same: Charge quickly from 0% to around 75 / 80. Then it gets harder to cram more electrons in the limited space so the charge slows down. The ‚Äúunder-charge‚Äù rule isn‚Äôt to protect from over-charging; it‚Äôs to prevent long-term battery degradation.
subs.rawText: @ashishmohta @ThatBlairGuy Teslas and other EVs do the same: Charge quickly from 0% to around 75 / 80. Then it gets harder to cram more electrons in the limited space so the charge slows down. The ‚Äúunder-charge‚Äù rule isn‚Äôt to protect from over-charging; it‚Äôs to prevent long-term battery degradation.
